definition: topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: His works are "evening star" and "Untitled song" and so on.
sentences.chinese: 其作品有《黃昏的星》和《無題的歌》等。

sentences.english: They contributed a lot to the development of the art of Chinese poetry.
sentences.chinese: 無題詩對詩歌藝術的發展貢獻很大。

sentences.english: Only so can one grasp Li Shangyins connotation of thought better.
sentences.chinese: 這樣才能更好地把握李商隱“無題”詩的思想內涵。

sentences.english: Untitled, on the other hand, reveals Zao's manipulation of playfulness over abstraction.
sentences.chinese: 《無題》則表現了趙無極進一步發展的抽象趣味。

sentences.english: I am sitting in the dusk, listening to loneliness weave an untitled tale.
sentences.chinese: 我坐在黃昏裏，聽寂寞編織一個無題的故事。

definition: vertical scroll (painting or calligraphy)/vertical shaft (of a machine)
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with
to recall with emotion/to feel sentiments
to recall the past/to cherish the memory of past events/to reminisce/nostalgic
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
